1.title: Pilot
1.plot: In the fictional town of Sunrise, we follow an angry and secluded girl, Kelly Turner and the popular high school football running back, Jason Walker. As the school year starts, they both find themselves in daily struggles with their parents and school and feel the pressure grow.

2.title: Shadow
2.plot: Jason is placed in an awkward position since becoming the captain of his football team. Jason is stuck between doing what's right and getting back at David for quitting the team. Jason is placed in an awkward position since becoming the captain of his football team. Jason is stuck between doing what's right and getting back at David for quitting the team. After Kelly treats her Dad's girlfriend Stacey with malice, she gets a punishment that she couldn't imagine; helping Stacey at her cheerleading gym.

3.title: Reflection
3.plot: Kelly, now working for Stacey's cheerleading gym, tries to find ways to get out of work by getting in trouble at school. A stuck-up cheerleader Britney only makes things worse for her. Jason, dealing with David's departure and the pressure of his fathers' high expectations, gets peer pressured into pulling a prank for the football team and meets Kelly in the process.

4.title: Clash
4.plot: Jason and Kelly, both in trouble at school for their actions start to come to terms with their situations. Jason begins to deal with his father, as he gets worse at practice. Jason talks with his younger brother Ryan about his problems. In the mean time, Kelly, still working for Stacey, shows some promise in cheerleading and meets an attractive fellow gym worker Nathan.

5.title: Decision
5.plot: Kelly, still in shock in trying out, shrugs off the possibility of being in Stacey's senior team. Kelly's cousin, Michelle, tries to convince her that she actually enjoyed it. Jason, is getting more intrigued at joining cheerleading but torn by his father's expectations. He's also getting pressure from his ex-girlfriend, Megan, to get back together with him.

6.title: Proposition
6.plot: As Kelly deals of being on the team, she must decide if this is what she wants to do and how to handle Nathan. Jason is still unsure what his direction is. As life pushes both Kelly and Jason, they both must make decisions that can affect everything in their lives.

imdb.plot outline: When Kelly Turner was 10 years old, while returning from a cheer-leading competition, she witnessed something that would change her relationship with her mother forever. After Kelly's confession, her mother deserted her and her father without an explanation. Because of this, Kelly blames herself for her mothers' absence in her life. Now, Kelly has shut out just about everyone who cared about her in her life, except for her father, and her teenage cousin Michelle. Kelly is afraid of being hurt again by the people she loves and in turn stays emotionally disconnected from everyone. This year is different though. Kelly's father is getting serious with his new girlfriend Stacey, an all-star cheer-leading coach. When Kelly lashes out with contempt for her, Kelly's father makes her work for Stacey at her cheer gym, the last place she wants to be. Jason Walker is outgoing, likable and on the high school football team but knows football is not in his future. Jason's father, a controlling former college football star who was injured indefinitely on the first play of his professional career, now lives through Jason. He turned his love for the game into a dark obsession. Jason is compelled by his father to play football and his father will do just about anything to make sure Jason does what he says. Afraid of what lies ahead, Jason begins talking with his teammates who all seem to have a plan. He becomes jealous of the fact that they are in control of their own destiny, unlike himself. However, things are changing this year. After Jason pulls a prank on a guy that deserted the football team for cheer-leading, he becomes seduced by the sport of cheer-leading. Not only because of the attractive cheerleaders, but because it's something that can make him happy. Kelly and Jason are drawn to cheerleading, not because they have to, but because it's the only thing that can liberate them from their dark lives. Now, Kelly who is running from her past and Jason who is running from his future find themselves thrown into this unlikely sport. Even though it is obvious they are meant for each other, obstacles from their past begin to haunt them.
imdb.title: Liberty
plot: When Kelly Turner was 10 years old, while returning from a cheer-leading competition, she witnessed something that would change her relationship with her mother forever. After Kelly's confession, her mother deserted her and her father without an explanation. Because of this, Kelly blames herself for her mothers' absence in her life. Now, Kelly has shut out just about everyone who cared about her in her life, except for her father, and her teenage cousin Michelle. Kelly is afraid of being hurt again by the people she loves and in turn stays emotionally disconnected from everyone. This year is different though. Kelly's father is getting serious with his new girlfriend Stacey, an all-star cheer-leading coach. When Kelly lashes out with contempt for her, Kelly's father makes her work for Stacey at her cheer gym, the last place she wants to be. Jason Walker is outgoing, likable and on the high school football team but knows football is not in his future. Jason's father, a controlling former college football star who was injured indefinitely on the first play of his professional career, now lives through Jason. He turned his love for the game into a dark obsession. Jason is compelled by his father to play football and his father will do just about anything to make sure Jason does what he says. Afraid of what lies ahead, Jason begins talking with his teammates who all seem to have a plan. He becomes jealous of the fact that they are in control of their own destiny, unlike himself. However, things are changing this year. After Jason pulls a prank on a guy that deserted the football team for cheer-leading, he becomes seduced by the sport of cheer-leading. Not only because of the attractive cheerleaders, but because it's something that can make him happy. Kelly and Jason are drawn to cheerleading, not because they have to, but because it's the only thing that can liberate them from their dark lives. Now, Kelly who is running from her past and Jason who is running from his future find themselves thrown into this unlikely sport. Even though it is obvious they are meant for each other, obstacles from their past begin to haunt them.::Marcelo Ribeiro
